Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 6th overall pick, by Chicago (N) in 1966...
Injured on 9/5/1966 with a Pulled Bicep Muscle, out for 6 weeks...
Injured on 4/1/1968 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for one week...

Had first career hit on 5/22/1969, off Tug McGraw (SF)...
Earned first career win on 5/28/1969...
Injured on 8/25/1969 with a Ruptured Bicep Tendon, out for 4 weeks...
Hit first career homerun on 9/18/1970, off John E. Miller (CIN)...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/28/1971, winning 2 games with a 0.50 ERA...

Was selected to the 1979 Allstar game...
Injured on 7/13/1979 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Signed as a free agent by Cleveland on 2/11/1980 to a 4-year deal worth $13,640,000 per year...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/11/1980, winning 2 games with a 1.62 ERA...
